Warm-up

Write a function called count_words that takes a string and counts the number of words in the string. Assume each word is separated by a single space, and the string will contain at least one word. For example, "Today is Wednesday." contains 3 words.

Structs: Q2

struct one {
    char x;
    char y;
    short z;
};
struct two {
    int m;
    int n[10];
};
int main() {
    struct one a;
    struct two b;
    printf("%d %d\n", sizeof(struct one), sizeof(a.z));
    printf("%d %d\n", sizeof(b), sizeof(b.n));
}

Structs: Q3

struct alpha {
    char x[10];
    int y;
};
struct beta {
    int b;
    int c;
};
int main() {
    struct alpha a = { "Colgate", 13 };
    struct beta b = { 1, 2 };
    struct beta c = { 3, 4 };
    a.y += -13;
    b.b = 5;
    c = b;
    b.c = 6;
    printf("a %s %d\n", a.x, a.y);
    printf("b %d %d\n", b.b, b.c);
    printf("c %d %d\n", c.b, c.c);
}

Binary (i.e., base 2)

Q4: 0b10

Q5: 0b11

Q6: 0b1010

Q7: 0b1111

Q8: 0b11001100

Hexadecimal (i.e., base 16)

Q9: 0x9

Q10: 0xB

Q11: 0xF

Q12: 0x11

Q13: 0x248
